casebody.data:
NORTH CAROLINA BOARD OF MORTUARY SCIENCE
v.
CROWN MEMORIAL PARK, L.L.C. No. 80A04. Supreme Court of North Carolina. April 1, 2004. L. Holmes Eleazer, Jr., Charlotte, Fenton T. Erwin, Jr., for Crown Memorial Park. M. Jackson Nichols, Raleigh, for Bd. of Mortuary Science. Thomas L. Odom, Jr., Charlotte, Clark Neily, for Institute of Justice. Prior report: __ N.C.App. ___, 590 S.E.2d 467 .

ORDER

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal from the North Carolina Court of Appeals, filed by the Defendant on the 24th day of February 2004 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-30, and the motion to dismiss the appeal for lack of substantial constitutional question filed by the Plaintiff, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the motion to dismiss the appeal is

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 1st day of April 2004."
